org.openehealth.ipf.commons.flow.config

Class ApplicationConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openehealth.ipf.commons.flow.config.ApplicationConfig

  • @Entity
public class ApplicationConfig
extends Object
    Persistent configuration data for an application.
    Author:
    Martin Krasser

        public void setApplication(String application)

      • isFlowFilterEnabled

        public boolean isFlowFilterEnabled()

      • setFlowFilterEnabled

        public void setFlowFilterEnabled(boolean flowFilterEnabled)
        Set to true to enable filtering of flows. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        flowFilterEnabled - whether filter is enabled
        See Also:
        FLOW_FILTER_ENABLED_DEFAULT

      • isFlowCleanupEnabled

        public boolean isFlowCleanupEnabled()

      • setFlowCleanupEnabled

        public void setFlowCleanupEnabled(boolean flowCleanupEnabled)
        Set to true to cleanup (remove message content from) successful flow. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        flowCleanupEnabled - whether cleanup is enabled
        See Also:
        FLOW_CLEANUP_ENABLED_DEFAULT

      • isFlowPurgeScheduled

        public boolean isFlowPurgeScheduled()

      • setFlowPurgeScheduled

        public void setFlowPurgeScheduled(boolean flowPurgeScheduled)
        Set to true is a flow purge job has been scheduled. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        flowPurgeScheduled - whether purge is scheduled
        See Also:
        FLOW_PURGE_SCHEDULED_DEFAULT

      • isDoNotPurgeErrorFlows

        public boolean isDoNotPurgeErrorFlows()

      • setDoNotPurgeErrorFlows

        public void setDoNotPurgeErrorFlows(boolean doNotPurgeErrorFlows)
        Set to true to exclude ERROR flows from being purged. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        doNotPurgeErrorFlows - whether purge is disabled
        See Also:
        DO_NOT_PURGE_ERROR_FLOWS_DEFAULT

      • getFlowPurgeSchedule

        public String getFlowPurgeSchedule()

      • setFlowPurgeSchedule

        public void setFlowPurgeSchedule(String flowPurgeSchedule)
        Sets the purge schedule's Cron expression. Default is 0 0 1 * * ? which means 1:00 am every day.
        Parameters:
        flowPurgeSchedule - purge schedule
        See Also:
        FLOW_PURGE_SCHEDULE_DEFAULT

      • getPurgeFlowsOlderThan

        public String getPurgeFlowsOlderThan()

      • setPurgeFlowsOlderThan

        public void setPurgeFlowsOlderThan(String purgeFlowsOlderThan)
        Set the duration or minimum age of flows to be purged. Default is 30d which means flows older than 30 days will be purged by jobs triggered by the given purge schedule.
        Parameters:
        purgeFlowsOlderThan - time after which flows shall be purged
        See Also:
        PURGE_FLOWS_OLDER_THAN_DEFAULT
